name: CreateIncident
description:
Create an incident in PagerDuty.

Use this tool to create an incident in PagerDuty when there is a problem or issue that needs attention and resolution.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to use via the 'Accept' header, formatted as 'application/vnd.pagerduty+json;version=2'.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the media type of the resource, must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

value_schema.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

parameters.name: incident_details
parameters.description: Details of the incident to be created, including type, title, service, priority, urgency, body, incident_key, assignments, incident_type, escalation_policy, and conference_bridge.

title.description: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the incident.

incident_key.description: A string which identifies the incident. Sending subsequent requests referencing the same service and with the same incident_key will result in those requests being rejected if an open incident matches that incident_key.

assignments.description: Assign the incident to these assignees. Cannot be specified if an escalation policy is given.

name.description: The name of the Incident Type.

conference_number.description: The phone number of the conference call for the conference bridge. Phone numbers should be formatted like +1 415-555-1212,,,,1234#, where a comma (,) represents a one-second wait and pound (#) completes access code input.

conference_url.description: An URL for the conference bridge. This could be a link to a web conference or Slack channel.

incident.description: Details of the incident to be created.
